repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
this PR adds initial support for compiling on haiku os:

some deps can be pulled from haiku repos, some need to be compiled with nvim's dep build system:
```
cmake -DUSE_BUNDLED_LIBUV=OFF -DUSE_BUNDLED_UNIBILIUM=OFF -DUSE_BUNDLED_LUAJIT=OFF -B .deps ./cmake.deps
make -C .deps
```

comment_data.body:
please check the lint CI. at least it's probably complaining about this, maybe other things too:


```suggestion
# define I_PUSH NULL // XXX: find the actual value
```

ideally we would define a `HAVE_XX` that describes the semantic "feature family" being guarded, so that we don't have zillions of platform-specific decision trees throughout the codebase. if that doesn't make sense for this PR then can make an exception.

probably cleaner to just add this to where the first target_link_libraries for haiku is on lin 154 (think you can even combine them into a single target_link_libraries if you use main_lib or nvim_bin for both of them)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -168,6 +170,8 @@ elseif(CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME MATCHES "OpenBSD")
   target_link_libraries(main_lib INTERFACE pthread c++abi)
 elseif(CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME STREQUAL "SunOS")
   target_link_libraries(nvim_bin PRIVATE -lsocket)
+elseif(CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME STREQUAL "Haiku")
+  target_link_libraries(nvim_bin PRIVATE -lnetwork)

comment_data.body: seems ok. any unix-like without HAVE_FORKPTY needs this block
well, HAVE_FORKPTY is only unset for sunos (and now haiku) from what i can tell..
it is set for all unixes: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/477b43aa7ff7ef081f9552f59caf344f23102000/cmake.config/CMakeLists.txt#L104

comment_regular_data.body: why is the macos check failing?

> why is the macos check failing?

github outage, can ignore those
I updated BUILD.md in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/36670, please glance at it and LMK if it looks ok.

title: build: haiku os support
